channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-14203] remove duplicate code getTableDescriptor in HTable
item.description:
As TODO in comment said,
HTable.getTableDescriptor is same as HAdmin.getTableDescriptor. remove the duplicate code.
item.summary: remove duplicate code getTableDescriptor in HTable

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12749760/HBASE-14203.patch
against master branch at commit 3d5801602da7cde1f20bdd4b898e8b3cac77f2a3.

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

+1 hadoop versions. The patch compiles with all supported hadoop versions (2.4.0 2.4.1 2.5.0 2.5.1 2.5.2 2.6.0 2.7.0)

Creating an Admin is a costly operation. Maybe we can extract the method to be a static one.

Thanks for your reply!

I check the code, it has some difficulty to extract getTableDescriptor to be a static one. Because in this function it calls non-static function. To avoid create Admin every time when call Connection.getAdmin(), we can use Singleton instance.

I update the patch.

Don't synchronize on a non-final field. Additionally I'm pretty sure that most of the tests are failing as they assume that getAdmin will create a new HBaseAdmin.

Don't synchronize on a non-final field. Additionally I'm pretty sure that most of the tests are failing as they assume that getAdmin will create a new HBaseAdmin.

Thanks for your replay!

Testcase failed is due to NPE when synchronized(admin), I use another final field adminLock to sync as you said.

The patch is updated!

This message is automatically generated.

Sorry this is not the right approach. We cannot have a singleton Admin returned from Connection.getAdmin().
An Admin can be created in Connection impl, and maintained in the Connection lifecycle, and this Admin can be passed to HTable on creation.

An Admin can be created in Connection impl, and maintained in the Connection lifecycle, and this Admin can be passed to HTable on creation.

Can i create HbaseAdmin instance in ConnectionImplementation constructor, and return this instance when call Connection.getAdmin()

Can i create HbaseAdmin instance in ConnectionImplementation constructor, and return this instance when call Connection.getAdmin()

The contract for Connection.getAdmin() implies a new Admin is created which is then closed by the caller.
I would pursue the static methods approach if you ask me.

I would pursue the static methods approach if you ask me.

Thanks for your reply!

You are right, i extract the method to be static.

update the patch

This message is automatically generated.
Enis Soztutar any suggestions?

Thanks Heng Chen, patch looks good. Two more suggestions:

  • lets make this package-protected. We do not want to expose it to users: 
    
+  public static HTableDescriptor getTableDescriptor(final TableName tableName,
  • It is not you, but we had recently changed the meta table descriptor so that it is not hard coded anymore in HBaseAdmin. Let's also not return the hard coded one in HTable and be consistent with the HBaseAdmin one: 
    
+    if (tableName != null && tableName.equals(TableName.META_TABLE_NAME)) {

       return HTableDescriptor.META_TABLEDESC;

     }

Thank Enis Soztutar for your reply!

I update the patch as your suggestions
